dublin_core.dcvalue: Digital What Where Why Practical Approaches for Mainstreaming Use of the Digital Health Atlas This session focuses on providing an overview of the functionality of the Health Data Collaborative global technology registry The Digital Health Atlas DHA and the processes that governments implementers technologists and donor institutions can take to leverage the customizable web platform to facilitate unique registration assessment planning monitoring coordination and planning for digital health deployments The session focuses on the findings of a set of multi country workshops targeting governments implementation organizations and donor agencies that focused on capacity building for institutionalization of the Digital Health Atlas into standard practice The session offers an interactive learning session for different stakeholder groups including sharing relevant standard operating procedures recent experiences with deployments and lessons learned that will facilitate update and effective use Presented by Dr Carl LeitnerDeputy Director Global GoodsDigital Square PATH Dr Garrett MehlScientistWorld Health Organization
Introduction to the Digital Health Atlas
